hook.text: A coworker's tone makes you furious. But your partner uses the same tone and you feel nothing. Why the difference?

buildup.text: Triggers are personal. They're shaped by past experiences, unmet needs, and core beliefs about yourself.

discovery.text: Most triggers trace back to feeling dismissed, disrespected, or unsafe. The present activates an old wound.

twist.text: The trigger is never really about the other person. It's about what their behavior means to your inner story.

climax.text: Map your triggers. Write down what provokes you, then ask why. The pattern reveals the deeper sensitivity.

punchline.text: Know your triggers. They reveal your deeper story.

quiz.question: Why do different people trigger different emotional reactions?
options: Triggers are shaped by personal history and unmet needs
